item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 19, 2025 at 12:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. TikTok goes dark in the US (673 points | 1079 comments)
2. Haskell: A Great Procedural Language (89 points | 55 comments)
3. "The Traitors", a reality TV show, offers a useful economics lesson (30 points | 13 comments)
4. Kalman Filter Tutorial (306 points | 66 comments)
5. Forgejo: A self-hosted lightweight software forge (172 points | 103 comments)
6. How Unix spell ran in 64kb RAM (156 points | 30 comments)
7. Rust: Investigating an Out of Memory Error (41 points | 13 comments)
8. The "35-cent" Commodore 64 softmodem (62 points | 9 comments)
9. VS Code Pets (397 points | 105 comments)
10. Yek: Serialize your code repo (or part of it) to feed into any LLM (77 points | 33 comments)
11. GitHub introduces sub-issues, issue types and advanced search (110 points | 53 comments)
12. Show HN: Interactive systemd – a better way to work with systemd units (459 points | 156 comments)
13. Reverse Engineering a VanMoof E-Shifter – Part 2 – Decoding the Signals (17 points | 2 comments)
14. How I built this website on a Raspberry Pi (89 points | 47 comments)
15. Hologram: A full-stack isomorphic Elixir web framework (82 points | 22 comments)
16. Australian Open resorts to animated caricatures to bypass broadcast restrictions (171 points | 79 comments)
17. 'Once-in-a-century' discovery reveals luxury of Pompeii (61 points | 33 comments)
18. Japan's elderly are lonely and struggling. Some women choose to go to jail (7 points | 1 comment)
19. How hard would it be to display the contents of an image file on the screen? (3 points | discuss)
20. Tracing Military Command Chains Through Time and Location (62 points | 7 comments)
21. Boosting Computational Fluid Dynamics Performance with AMD MI300X (30 points | 10 comments)
22. Properties and Far-infrared Variability of a z = 7 Blazar (5 points | discuss)
23. Why do bees die when they sting you? (289 points | 211 comments)
24. Beating cuBLAS in Single-Precision General Matrix Multiplication (88 points | 7 comments)
25. Generating an infinite world with the Wave Function Collapse algorithm (222 points | 61 comments)
26. Second-Hand Bookshops in Britain: 2024 Report (69 points | 24 comments)
27. WASM GC isn't ready for realtime graphics (118 points | 59 comments)
28. Pharaoh's Tomb HD – A Remake Made in JavaScript with Kaplay (94 points | 38 comments)
29. The AMD Radeon Instinct MI300A's Giant Memory Subsystem (196 points | 82 comments)
30. Dusa Programming Language (Finite-Choice Logic Programming) (147 points | 33 comments)
